item.title: How to Eat
item.description:
üèãÔ∏è Weight Gain & Recovery Plan

Target: Recover to 75 kg (from 64 kg) Daily Target: ~2,900 Calories | ~140g Protein

üìÖ 1. The Daily Schedule

Consistency is key. Aim to follow this schedule 7 days a week.

Meal Time Menu Items Nutrition Goals
Breakfast 08:00 The Mass ShakeBlend the following:‚Ä¢ 100g Oats‚Ä¢ 350ml Whole Milk‚Ä¢ 2 tbsp Peanut Butter‚Ä¢ 1 Banana 850 kcal35g Protein
Lunch 13:00 Rice/Pasta Bowl‚Ä¢ 150g Pasta or Rice (weighed dry)‚Ä¢ 150g Ground Beef or Chicken Thighs‚Ä¢ 1 cup Mixed Veggies‚Ä¢ 1 tbsp Olive Oil (for cooking) 750 kcal40g Protein
Snack 16:30 Nuts & Fruit‚Ä¢ 60g Nuts (Almonds/Walnuts/Peanuts)‚Ä¢ 1 Apple 500 kcal15g Protein
Dinner 20:00 Potato & Eggs Plate‚Ä¢ 400g Potatoes (Mashed/Boiled) + 1 tbsp Butter‚Ä¢ 3 Large Eggs (Fried/Scrambled) or 1 tin Tuna‚Ä¢ 250ml glass of Whole Milk 800 kcal40g Protein
TOTAL ~2,900 kcal~130g+ Protein

üõí 2. Shopping Lists (No Freezer Strategy)

Shopping is split twice a week to keep meat and produce fresh.

item.title: When Can You Retire
item.description:
4% rule: save 25 times your expected spending in your first year of retirement. Spending increase by 3% each year. – relatively conservative

The crossover point rule: When your monthly investment income exceeds your monthly expenses.

Crossover assets = Monthly expenses * Monthly investment return

item.title: Stop Consuming
item.description: It is high time to stop sonsuming and create something great with this life.

item.title: When to Start a Business
item.description:
robomartin on Feb 2, 2024

My favorite quote: “A man holding a cat by the tail learns something he can learn in no other way” -Mark Twain

You need to grab that tail and learn things you will not otherwise.

From that it follows that the answer to your question is: As early as possible.

This also means you probably should not make your first experiences the most grandiose ideas. You might actually want to assume failure. Don’t assume you know anything about business at all. Jump in. Make mistakes. Learn. If you get lucky, great. If your experience is +/- on standard deviation from the mean, you’ll come out of the experience all cut-up and bloody (image: holding cat by tail). And you will also come out with tons of wisdom. That’s why you don’t bet the farm on your first attempts. You are far more likely to fail. Don’t worry. Keep going. Make small bets. Don’t risk it all in one hand. Make small bets and learn.

item.title: Lifestyle creep
item.description:
Lifestyle creep is when someone increases their spending after experiencing an increase in income or as a way of keeping up with their peers.

Once you spend more than 50% of your future raises, then you start delaying your retirement.

item.title: How to save more
item.description:
Dminishing marginal utility: Eeach additional unit of consumption brings about less benefit than the unit before it.

The biggest lie in personal finace is that you can be rich if you just cut your spending.

The most consistent way to get rich is to grow your income and invest in income-producing assets.

The main porint is to tighten up where you can, then focus on increasing your income.

Sell your time/expertise: Doesn’t scale. Can’t get extremely wealthy.
